metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19627 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
In Wireshark 2.6.0 to 2.6.4 and 2.4.0 to 2.4.10, the IxVeriWave file parsercould crash. This was addressed in wiretap/vwr.c by adjusting a bufferboundary.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19627` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
libwireshark11 - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
libwiretap8 - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
libwsutil9 - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
tshark - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
wireshark - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
wireshark-common - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
wireshark-qt - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.0').
